questions.question: Who is considered the 'father of Artificial Intelligence'?
Which of these is a common application of AI?
What is the Turing Test used to measure?
options: A machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior equivalent to, or indistinguishable from, that of a human
A machine's ability to perform complex calculations
questions.answer: A machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior equivalent to, or indistinguishable from, that of a human

questions.question: What is 'Weak AI' (or Narrow AI)?
options: AI that can outperform humans in all tasks
AI designed and trained for a particular task
AI that has not yet been fully developed
questions.answer: AI designed and trained for a particular task

questions.question: Which programming language is most commonly associated with AI and Machine Learning?
What is the primary goal of supervised learning?
options: To learn a mapping from inputs to outputs
To learn through trial and error
To find hidden patterns in data
questions.answer: To learn a mapping from inputs to outputs

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an unsupervised learning task?
What does a 'training set' refer to in machine learning?
options: The data used to test the model's performance
The data used to train the model
The hardware used to run the model
A set of instructions for the model
questions.answer: The data used to train the model

questions.question: What is 'overfitting' in the context of machine learning?
options: When a model performs well on new, unseen data
When a model is too simple to capture the underlying trend of the data
When a model performs very well on training data but poorly on new data
When a model is trained for too long
questions.answer: When a model performs very well on training data but poorly on new data

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification tasks?
What is reinforcement learning?
options: Learning through rewards and punishments for actions
questions.answer: Learning through rewards and punishments for actions

questions.question: Deep Learning is a subfield of which broader AI field?
What are the fundamental building blocks of a neural network?
What does the 'deep' in Deep Learning refer to?
options: The complexity of the problems it solves
The large amount of data it requires
The number of layers in the neural network
The depth of knowledge of its creators
questions.answer: The number of layers in the neural network

questions.question: What is an 'activation function' in a neural network?
options: A function that starts the training process
A function that determines if a neuron should be activated or not
A function that calculates the loss
A function that normalizes the input data
questions.answer: A function that determines if a neuron should be activated or not

questions.question: Which of these is a popular deep learning framework?
What is a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) primarily used for?
